Improvements.Improvement: Use try-catch for array index out of bounds
Improvements.Description: Instead of manually checking if the sourceIndex is out of bounds, use a try-catch block to catch ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException. This makes the code cleaner and more readable.
Java's built-in shift methods automatically handle the case where the shift distance is greater than the operand's size. So, there is no need to manually calculate 'shiftMod'.
